Good game, salty players. New players can expect to feel a steep learning curve. Changes to the game over time have decreased game quality and introduced bugs that can ruin the game experience. Past its prime and I'm not hopeful for it to come back stronger. Dead by Daylight is dying.

Update: Survivor DBD in 2021 is, across ranks, shaped by 20min+ match queues that take longer than the game itself, just to be kept out of match after consuming your offering because someone in the lobby is running the game on min specs and doesn't load on time // Killers swinging through pallets entirely as well as other unnecessary handicaps like blindness & oblivious // Impressively toxic players and useless reports, unavoidably rematching with the same survivors/killers along with other terrible matchmaking // Frequent killers that don't manage to try playing or choose half-assed BP farming // Even hackers have managed to completely disrupt matches and happily talk about how long they've been doing so in end-game chat // Gameplay menu settings getting reset every time you return to lobby, not even relaunch, requiring read-only toggled on the ini to retain // Nearly useless ultra rare item addons which hardly make any impact AND being unable to retain addons without using "Ace in the Hole" perk

Mar2022: Modern DBD is one of the worst gaming experiences I have ever experienced myself. It's wild how the devs mishandle every aspect of the game and its quality has consistently gotten worse over time. Stay far away.

In this game you will suffer, die, get mad and want to commit, But this game will push you to become toxic survivor with flashlights/ OR just buy best dlc for killer and kill others


10/10 WIll try not spend my money on this game

ну такое

INTRODUCTION

Updated review as of 3.5.0.

I have put nearly 4,000 hours into this game (plus a few hundred on console), was a top 1% Killer player / top 5% survivor player on the leaderboard (https://dbd.onteh.net.au/), has spent more money on cosmetics / DLC than I care to admit, and has nearly every single character to P3 50 (max prestige) with nearly every single perk. I know what I'm talking about here.

FOR NEW PLAYERS

1. Expensive

In order to gain access to over half the perks in the game as well as most of the best ones, you will need to spend more money on the nearly $100 worth of DLC or try your hand at the Weekly Shrine which requires grinding to even purchase from and will rarely have what you are looking for.

It's also worth mention that due to this game's current meta, you are gonna want the majority of these DLC perks to do well. Even if you aren't playing seriously, the game will get real dull and real frustrating real fast without most of these perks.

2. The Grind

Once you have access to these perks you need to actually unlock them on your characters. Which requires leveling up the character they are tied to so you can unlock their "teachable perk." You then have to go to the character that you actually want the perk on and level them up for the CHANCE of seeing ONE out of the THREE tiers of this perk. 

This problem get's even worse the more you play as the perk pile get's bigger and bigger. Most everyone of my P3 50 characters don't even have all the perks, even after all the time I spent in game.

3. Learning Curve

The game is deceptively complicated as there are so many different techs, loops, pathing options, mindgames, jukes and hitbox quirks that getting better as a new player is even more difficult when  you can't tell how you are being outplayed. This isn't even mentioning all of the different killers and their quirks either.

Plus the in game tutorial teaches you practically nothing.

4. Matchmaking

IMO the biggest reason not to get this game. You WILL play with people like me who have so much more experience at the game than you do. It is way too common that newbies get paired up with killers that steamroll them and teams that berate them for not contributing. All the while still learning how to play the damn game. The grind and the learning curve will all become much worse and it will kill your desire to play the game.

FOR VETERAN PLAYERS

1. Balance

The game is way too fast for Killers, causing killers to use builds entirely built to slowdown the survivor team or just play the same top tier killers everytime. On the flipside survivor is very stagnant with the best survivor perks being so good at what they do, that there is no point in taking anything else. Survivor also becomes unfun when playing against the same few killers and the same builds that are all centered around making the game take longer.

Memem builds and off-meta builds are much less fun when everything can go so wrong so fast on both sides.

2. Incompetence

The devs are just a dumpster fire of incompetence. They would rather fix the matchmaking problem by just hiding the ranks and pretend it's not a problem (yes they actually tried to do that). They have been constantly adding band-aid fixes to this game without addressing any of the core issues, or even Acknowledging them in the case of gen speed (even though the community almost universally agrees it's a problem)

They constantly make higher level play worse while trying to improve the experience for new players. Even though the new player experience isn't being improved at all. (Not saying the game should be balanced around top level play, just pointing this issue out).

I don't think they are biased towards one side I just think they are morons who don't know what they are doing.

CONCLUSION:

I wish I could have had my more detailed review here, but alas Steam is an ass and likes to delete the entire textbox if you breathe in the direction of your mouse.

Nevertheless I hope this helps you make an informed decision about purchasing the game. I just wish I would have jumped ship sooner.
